Acts decisively to protect Eddie by driving the bus through a dangerous situation, risking his own safety.
Hears commotion, quickly assesses situation by peering out the bus window.
Responds immediately to attack by crawling to the driver’s seat, starting the bus, and accelerating through barricades under heavy fire.
Maintains control of the bus despite it listing and sparks flying, showing skill under pressure.
Almost speechless and emotionally affected when Eddie slides the notebook and speaks, momentarily distracted.
Quickly spots a metal sign indicating a possible escape route and acts on it by steering the bus sharply into the alley, evading SWAT teams.
Successfully maneuvers the bus at high speed through a narrow alley despite heavy gunfire and obstacles, demonstrating skill and presence of mind.
Turns back to retrieve Eddie’s dropped notebook despite the urgency, showing care and responsibility.
Races to help Eddie after he falls, pulls him to his feet, and supports him towards the courthouse.
Presses on Eddie’s wound, covers it with his own shirt, and reassures him help is coming.
Encourages Eddie to stay awake and communicate despite the dire situation.

Quickly reacts to Eddie’s collapse by pulling him to his feet and continuing towards the courthouse, demonstrating decisiveness and physical capability under pressure.
Uses his shirt to apply pressure to Eddie’s neck wound and reassures him, showing practical first aid knowledge and emotional control.
Encourages Eddie to stay awake and communicate, attempting to maintain Eddie’s consciousness and morale, indicating mental resilience and leadership.
Initially willing to ignore the notebook to keep moving but then changes course to retrieve it, which could be seen as a momentary lapse in judgment or hesitation.
Presses shirt against Eddie’s neck to slow blood flow, shows concern and urgency.
Expresses hope and encouragement to Eddie despite grim situation.

Listens carefully and pieces together Eddie’s story, demonstrating attentive and thoughtful engagement.

Asks Diane for another favor despite his injured state, indicating awareness of his needs and ability to plan ahead.

Maintains composure and engages in meaningful conversation with Eddie, showing emotional intelligence and self-awareness.
Nods and silently acknowledges Eddie's hopeful perspective despite his own cynicism.
Stares into space, reflecting on past mistakes and the lack of second chances, showing internal struggle.
Reflects on past mistakes and the lack of second chances, showing awareness and seriousness about consequences.

Tries to listen carefully to outside sounds, showing alertness and situational awareness.

Moves cautiously with Eddie through the underground parking structure, indicating awareness and careful approach.
Checks his watch while observing the heavily barricaded courthouse, demonstrating situational awareness and time management.
Shoves Eddie out of the way to protect him from gunfire.
Uses his gun to smash the fluorescents, plunging the area into darkness to help Eddie hide.
Says to Eddie 'I should bring you in right' and 'Think of us as two shits passing in the night,' indicating a resigned but somewhat dismissive attitude.
Checks his watch and prepares handcuffs calmly before approaching the doors, showing situational awareness and readiness.
Notices the absence of pigeons and immediately reacts by pushing Eddie out of the way as gunfire erupts, demonstrating alertness and quick reflexes.
Fires his weapon blindly while taking cover, then moves strategically to protect Eddie, showing tactical skill under pressure.
Uses his gun to smash the fluorescents, plunging the area into darkness to gain a tactical advantage, indicating resourcefulness and strategic thinking.
Moves silently and stays low while navigating the parking structure, demonstrating stealth and caution.
Shoves Eddie inside the car, removes his cuffs, and cracks the window to give him a chance to escape.
Instructs Eddie to stay put and run when he calls, showing concern for his safety.
Leads Mulvey, Torres, and Nugent away from Eddie, putting himself at risk to protect him.
Eases open the back door quietly, removes cuffs, and instructs Eddie clearly on what to do, showing calm control under pressure.
Stays low and uses the environment to his advantage, leading pursuers away from Eddie.
Surprises Torres by attacking from an unexpected angle and incapacitates him quickly.
Attempts to bait Nugent into following him, showing tactical thinking.
Does not notice the door not being completely closed, which could be a security oversight.
Drags Nugent inside the church, ties his hands to restrain him, preventing further violence.
Refers to Nugent as 'bad guy' and Eddie as 'good guy; very good guy,' showing clear moral distinction and some sincerity.
Uses violence and intimidation (opening fire, jamming gun in Nugent's ear) to control the situation.
Surprises Nugent by jamming a .38 in his ear, preventing him from shooting.
Successfully captures and restrains Nugent quickly and efficiently in the church.
